title: Overview of dashboards
content:
By default, when accessing the Dashboard menu item, an agent user lands on the System Dashboard Definition, a generic collection of charts representing the set of modules supported by Service Management. Roles and permissions control the charts visible to each user. 

The system offers a set of out-of-the-box dashboards, which comply with ITIL best practices and target different user roles (such as Incident Manager, and Asset Manager). Agent users can add additional dashboards as desired. Agent users with the appropriate role permissions can create dashboard definitions for self-use or for sharing with specified audiences or all agent users. This way, agent users can view multiple dashboards from their dashboard home page. See dashboard definitions for more information. 

Without any modifications to roles, an agent without the Tenant Admin role can't modify an existing dashboard or save a private copy. To allow an agent to save a dashboard, the tenant admin needs to enable the relevant permissions for the Dashboard Definition record type. For more details, see the Assign dashboard role permissions section.

As agents with appropriate permissions may decide to modify existing public or group dashboards and save a personalized (private) copy, the number of private dashboards created by a user can be significant. An agent with permission to access the Administration > Master Data > Dashboard Definitions menu and has the relevant permissions for the Dashboard Definition record type can manage the records, delete unwanted copies, and modify existing definitions, and can also create new definitions from scratch. 

With access to the Dashboard Definitions module, a user with permissions can modify any record, including public dashboards (change content, visibility, ownership, etc.) unless additional controls are put in place. It's important to enable record-level access control. 

An agent user can modify the personal default dashboard from their profile page (see the Set your default dashboard section). Additionally, a tenant admin can define default dashboards per user, either manually in the Person record or by business rules added to the Person workflow. 

Dashboard user interface

The following screenshot shows the dashboard user interface.

The left pane (dashboard list pane) is collapsed by default. By default, this pane displays a number of out-of-the-box dashboards. You can hover over the icon next to each dashboard name, to see its access level. Each access level has a unique icon. 

  • Private: The dashboard is visible only to the user who created it
  • Group: The dashboard is visible only to one or more specified user groups
  • Public: The dashboard is visible to all agent users

The right pane (widget pane) displays the widgets in the current dashboard. See the examples below:

Search for a dashboard

  1. In the dashboard search box at the upper left corner, enter a keyword. For example, enter Asset. 
  2. Click the search icon. 
  3. The dashboard list pane displays the search results.

Sort the dashboard list

You can sort the dashboard list by name or by access level: 

  1. In the Sort by field on the dashboard list pane, select Dashboard Name A-Z or Access Level (Private/Group/Public). 
  2. The system automatically sorts the dashboard list according to your selection. 

Adjust the content or layout of a dashboard

You can adjust the content or layout of a dashboard for dynamic view. 

To add widgets to or remove widgets from the dashboard: 

  1. In the Dashboard window, click Click to add. The Add new widget to dashboard dialog box opens.

  2. Select the report to display on the Dashboard. For more information, see Reports list pane. 

    Alternatively, you can create a new report and add it directly to the dashboard. For more information, see How to work with reports.

  3. Click Add to add the report to the dashboard. 

To adjust the layout of a dashboard:

  1. Drag the widgets as you like. 
  2. Change the display type of a widget: table or chart.  
  3. Change the width of each widget (1 column, 2 columns, or 3 columns).

Want to save your changes? 

After you have made adjustments to the content or layout of a dashboard, you may or may not be able to save your changes:

  • If you have no permission to create or update dashboard definitions, you can't save your changes. When you navigate away, your changes get lost.
  • If you have permission to create or update dashboard definitions: 
    • If this is a public or group dashboard, you can't save your changes to it. When you navigate away, the system asks you if you want to save your changes to a private copy. You can click Save to save your changes to a private copy, which is named <source dashboard name>- copy by <your user name>. You can change the name by opening the record from Administration > Master Data > Dashboard Definitions. 
      The system allows you to create no more than one private copy from the same dashboard. If you have already created one private copy from the current dashboard, the system saves your changes to the existing private copy.
    • If this is a private dashboard that you created, when you navigate away, the system asks you if you want to save your changes. You can click Save to save your changes to the dashboard. 

Set your default dashboard

You can set your default dashboard from your user profile:

  1. Click your avatar. 
  2. Under Page preferences, select a dashboard in the Default dashboard field. 

If you ignore this task, the system will load a default dashboard assigned by your administrator or by the system. See Specify a default dashboard for users. 

Work with a widget

Each widget offers a set of tools, as described in the following table. 

UI Element Description
Displays the report data in a table format, or in a graph format.
Expands/collapses the widget window.

Enables you to:

  • Edit the report.
  • Remove the widget.
  • Export the report to a CSV file.
  • Export the report to a PDF file.
  • Configure the width of the widget on the page (1 column, 2 columns, or 3 columns).
